title: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: When using JDK 1.4, the All types dialog displays obfuscated classes (such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd'). This makes it difficult to find the relevant classes.
OB: The All types dialog shows obfuscated classes in the list.
EB: The obfuscated classes should be less prominent or excluded from the list.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the All types dialog.
2. Observe the presence of obfuscated classes.

Suggested solutions:
a) Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
b) Filter out the obfuscated classes completely.

I suggest implementing solution a) as it would make it easier to identify the relevant classes.
